title: Jack Straw: ‘I had no pay rise in the Cabinet as Brown was a hair-shirt chancellor’
text:
Jack Straw, 73, practised at the bar before becoming an MP in 1979. He served as home secretary, foreign secretary and leader of the House of Commons during Tony Blair’s premiership, and secretary of state for justice and lord chancellor under Gordon Brown.

He and his second wife, Alice, live in London and Oxfordshire. They have two children.

What was your childhood like?

We lived in a flat in a little Essex town called Buckhurst Hill. When I was six, we moved to a larger council maisonette in nearby Loughton.

My parents had five children and were very short of money, but our circumstances were made much worse because the marriage was dissolving. They should never have got married, but they had...
description: Jack Straw, 73, practised at the bar before becoming an MP in 1979.
